channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report I-2024100083
item.description:
Report I-2024100083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Heritage Transport
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Heritage transported this waste on Friday, September 20th and parked the truck at a Heritage owned "10 day" facility at 4925 Heller Street, Louisville, KY 40218. When the employee returned to work on Monday, 9/23, he observed the material had leaked out of its container, through the wooden truck bed of the box truck and onto the asphalt on the ground under the truck. During clean up, it was observed that lots of liquid had been put into this container.

item.title: Report E-2024100715
item.description:
Report E-2024100715

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFK experienced a UN1866 AlphaGuard Puma Quick Flash release from a 2-gallon metal pail. XPO terminal personnel conducted cleanup prior to ERTS notification. XPO advised one cup of product released to the trailer floor. The damaged pail and wood chips used to clean the material were placed together in a poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to properly containerize the waste and separate the product from the wood chips. Contractors arrived onsite and separated the damaged pail from the wood chips. The damaged pail appeared to be punctured by a forklift blade and was containerized into a 30-gallon metal drum. The impacted wood chips were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum and submerged as a precaution due to the low flash point of the material. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024090071
item.description:
Report I-2024090071

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-25
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LEWIS TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 525887
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver approached light at intersection of Old Henry Road and Terra Crossing Blvd. Driver had come to the light and almost stopped when the light turned green. The driver continued to tum left in the outside lane. As he was in the turn, the load took over and he overturned. When the fire dept and hazmat team arrived, they began with pads and oil dry. When the trailer was up righted on 729 gallons remained in compartment 3. Emergency response crews began with GRA-KA T arriving first. They enlisted the help of PECCO and Early Environmental. Later that night, PECCO was to take lead of the remediation and clean-up project. The following day, Shield Environmental was called in to geoprobe the site as well as private property. Lewis Personnel on site - Timothy Jennings and Raymond Boggs LMPD-Officer Koester Anchorage Middletown Fire Department/HazMat Team - Major Oser Battalion Chief Erica O'Brien, Environmental Specialist Sarah Hettel - KY State EPA Matt Vanderpool - Health Dept & Haz Mat Team Tracie Murphy - Spill Center

item.title: Report X-2024101591
item.description:
Report X-2024101591

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-29T09:23:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION THE LEAKING CONTENTS ARE TWO GALLONS OF A NON-REGULATED THOMAS BETTS CONDUIT TAPPING THREADING OIL. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS THAT WERE NOT LEAKING. DANGEROUS GOODS CONTENTS ARE SIX X 13-OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE CRC ZINC-IT INSTANT COLD GALVANIZE AND SIX X 13-OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE CRC BRIGHT ZINC-IT INSTANT COLD GALVANIZE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE FLAMMABLE AEROSOLS WERE BEING SHIPPED.
